intro: Perebea guianensis subsp. acanthogyne, commonly known as the Guianan perebea, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
